result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Chappell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, from the DOC out of up to 25% prison funds. To be paid within 1 year of leaving the House of Corrections.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence,  Huber privileges for work, treatment and Day Reporting Center.  
*10/8/2015 credit amended to 86 days.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Chappell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Granting Motion for Sentence Credit, filed and signed by the Court.  The defendant is granted 86 days of sentence credit.  The clerk's office shall send an amended judgment of conviction to the House of Correction.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. mag
Filed, Defendant's Motion To Modify Sentence
Decision and Order Denying Motion for Sentence Credit filed and signed by the Court.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. jbs
DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO MODIFY SENTENCE (seeking sentence credit) received and filed.

Defendant Charles Chappell in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Charles Chappell in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served, Huber privileges for work, treatment and Day Reporting Center.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, from the DOC out of up to 25% prison funds. To be paid within 1 year of leaving the House of Corrections.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Charles Chappell not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Projected guilty plea and sentencing.  Defense counsel in trial in another court and requests new date.  Case adjourned for Projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Charles Chappell not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests Projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Charles Chappell not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Charles Chappell not in court, in custody, not produced.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for scheduling conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles Chappell in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Charles Chappell in custody.  Ron Dague for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sears at 5200 S 76th Street, Village of Greendale

Defendant Charles Chappell in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Charles Chappell in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
